image.altText: A man stands in shadow, wearing a cap and looking out the window into a garden. The photo is taken from behind.

props.synopsis: The illegal use of ketamine reached a record high in 2023 in Australia. But as ketamine rises in popularity, so too do new chemical cousins of the drug — and their long-term side effects are "an unknown, unknown".

title.children: Ben knows taking illegal ketamine is risky but he's not worried about long-term addiction

image.altText: A woman in a grey hoodie walks through a doorway, looking serious.

props.synopsis: A former prominent Canberra basketball coach and player, Jesamine Wheeler, fronts the ACT Magistrates Court on four charges of child sex abuse against a 15-year-old girl in 2009.

title.children: Former Canberra basketball coach charged with four counts of child sexual abuse

image.altText: seven-network-journalist-robert-ovadia delivers the news as he looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Channel Seven senior journalist Robert Ovadia says he is prepared to defend "malicious" allegations made against him.

title.children: Seven senior reporter investigated over allegations of 'inappropriate behaviour'

image.altText: A row of tents in front of a long building at the Australian National University campus.

props.synopsis: ANU vice-chancellor Genevieve Bell tells a Senate estimates hearing that two students connected to pro-Palestinian protests on campus have been expelled, and are among 10 disciplinary actions launched since the protest began.

title.children: Disciplinary action taken against 10 students since ANU pro-Palestine encampment began, Senate estimates hears

image.altText: Artworks in a museum.

props.synopsis: Acclaimed artists Anni and Josef Albers were highly influential in the Bauhaus movement. Their works and love story are now set to be celebrated at the National Gallery of Australia.

title.children: Bauhaus transformed art and architecture, as a new exhibition in Canberra will show

image.altText: A man named Travis Barnard stands leaning against a wall in black pants and a brown shirt, typing on his mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Kim Heptinstall died after surgery in 2019, and in the hours afterwards Travis Paul Barnard changed the beneficiary of her superannuation to himself, gaining access to more than $300,000.

title.children: 'It's been hell': Family relieved as man jailed for stealing girlfriend's superannuation hours after sudden death

image.altText: Lachie Neale celebrates a goal for Brisbane

props.synopsis: Brisbane keeps itself in the race for the top eight as Lachie Neale and Eric Hipwood star in a convincing 43-point win against an overpowered Western Bulldogs.

title.children: Lions keep finals dream alive with comprehensive win over Bulldogs

image.altText: Two coaches, wearing hooded jumpers, talking to each other while walking on the field

props.synopsis: Zac Lomax's record-breaking night has helped catapult St George Illawarra into the NRL's top eight, as they handed Wests Tigers a ninth straight loss with a 56-14 humiliation.

title.children: 'I feel sorry for them': Tigers coach empathises with supporters, sends warning to his players after 56-14 thrashing

props.synopsis: The search for British TV doctor Michael Mosley is ramping up after he went missing in Greece. Here's what we know about the circumstances surrounding his disappearance so far.

title.children: A rocky trail and a phone left behind: Here's what we know about the disappearance of TV doctor Michael Mosley

image.altText: First-person perspective from man lying on the ground with a man in a suit looming over him.

props.synopsis: Nine Entertainment chairman Peter Costello denies assaulting a journalist at Canberra Airport after The Australian posted footage that appears to show Mr Costello walking towards reporter Liam Mendes, who was asking him questions, before Mr Mendes falls backwards.

title.children: Nine chairman Peter Costello denies assaulting journalist at Canberra Airport

image.altText: A man in a white jumper walks out of court with black sunglasses

props.synopsis: AFL premiership player, Daniel Kerr, has avoided more jail time for repeated domestic violence offences against his ex-partner over six years.

title.children: Daniel Kerr declared 'serial family violence offender' but spared jail for assaults on ex-partner

image.altText: Death to Palestine and swastikas are spray painted on a grey driveway.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne woman was putting her bins out when she found swastikas and Islamophobic hate plastered on her driveway, but she says she will not be intimidated. It comes amid a rise in Islamophobic hate attacks reported since October last year.

title.children: Rita was putting the bins out when she saw 'Death to Palestine' spray-painted on her driveway

image.altText: young man with short hair sits on couch whilst patting dog on his chest

props.synopsis: The ten-day trial of the man accused of murdering bottle shop worker Declan Laverty has begun in Darwin, with CCTV from inside the store played to the court.

title.children: Confronting new details of bottle shop worker stabbing revealed, as murder trial begins

image.altText: the outside of News Corp Australia's Holt Street headquarters in Sydney

props.synopsis: Sky News, The Australian and the Daily Telegraph used a photo of dancers in the Miriki Performing Arts group during a children's festival for a story on sexual abuse of Indigenous children last year.

title.children: News Corp apologises for using 'disrespectful' photo in Indigenous child sexual abuse story

image.altText: A woman in her early 40s - the artist Laura Jones - smiling and standing in front of her painting of Tim Winton

props.synopsis: Laura Jones has won the 2024 Archibald Prize for her portrait of Tim Winton.

title.children: 'Today shows I wasn't completely crazy': Laura Jones wins $100,000 Archibald Prize for portrait of Tim Winton

image.altText: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese attends a rally to a call for action to end violence against women.

props.synopsis: An advisory body of six people is tasked with providing a "rapid review" into "best-practice prevention approaches" when it comes to domestic violence against women and children.

title.children: 'Furious' First Nations advocates demand seat on DV advisory panel

image.altText: Australian Indigenous female runner Cathy Freeman, in stride, during her gold medal run at the Sydney Olympics

props.synopsis: Olympic legend Cathy Freeman says she never completely fulfilled her potential as an athlete, claiming she could have run faster in her career-defining 400-metre final at the 2000 Sydney Olympics.

title.children: 'Disappointed myself': Freeman says she could have run faster in famous gold medal win

image.altText: Submarine coming out of the water.

props.synopsis: The head of the AUKUS submarine program refuses to say whether an almost $5 billion government payment to the United States will be refunded if no nuclear-powered boats are delivered to Australia.

title.children: Submarine boss refuses to answer questions over multi-billion-dollar AUKUS payments

image.altText: A smiling young man in a helmet gives the peace sign on a cliff face with a pair of smiling rescuers nearby.

props.synopsis: Alex Farrelly-Deas, 25, says he climbed the cliff to take photos before slipping on his way back down.

title.children: 'More dangerous than I initially thought': Young hiker details 24-hour ordeal on WA cliff face

image.altText: A man crouches down to shake the hand of an older man sitting down.

props.synopsis: Rishi Sunak apologises on social media for leaving the event in Normandy prematurely to return to England for a TV interview ahead of the upcoming general election he called early.

title.children: UK prime minister apologises after being criticised by veterans for leaving D-Day commemorations early

image.altText: Louise Goode shouts as her former house is demolished behind her.

props.synopsis: Louise Goode's fight for the place of "emotional comfort" she called home lasted a quarter of a century, until it was demolished in front of her as she screamed for help.

title.children: 'Stop, please!' The moment a demolition crew ended an Australian's 25-year fight for her home

image.altText: A vegetable patch.

props.synopsis: People living in parts of Mullumbimby in the Byron Shire hinterland are being warned to avoid using groundwater or harvesting homegrown fruit and veggies after PFAS chemicals were detected near their fire station.

title.children: Backyard veggies off the menu after 'forever chemicals' detected in Byron Shire

image.altText: shannon fentiman in a white blazer and yellow top

props.synopsis: Shannon Fentiman has been referred to Queensland's parliamentary ethics committee over a social media video an LNP MP claimed "unleashed a wave of cyberbullying".

title.children: Queensland minister referred to ethics committee over 'potentially misleading' social media video

image.altText: A man with a beard and headset mic smiles

props.synopsis: A legend in the Kimberley with his distinctive white beard — Greg Quicke introduced generations of visitors and locals to the wonders of the universe through his "astro tours" in the town of Broome

title.children: Much-loved outback astronomer Greg 'Space Gandalf' Quicke dead at 62

image.altText: Beach is busy with people and city skyline in background.

props.synopsis: Holidaying in one of Australia's most popular tourist destinations could be about to get more expensive after a local government rate rise targeting short-term rentals.

title.children: Short-term rental prices likely to skyrocket on Gold Coast after council rate hike

image.altText: two people are looking at each other, a man is standing at a bar smiling, the woman is sitting, smiling and pointing at him.

props.synopsis: Scottish woman Fiona Harvey is seeking $255 million in damages saying she is the real-life inspiration behind the character Martha portrayed in the hit limited Netflix series Baby Reindeer.

title.children: Netflix to defend multi-million-dollar lawsuit filed by Fiona Harvey over Baby Reindeer

image.altText: A man and a baby in the shallow water at the beach.

props.synopsis: In his victim impact statement, Brent Cruse wrote, "When I looked down, I saw my foot was completely crushed". Mr Cruse said he worked as a labourer before the incident but would now be reliant on Centrelink payments.

title.children: 'Aggressive' snapchat messages behind teenager's decision to hit sister's partner with her car

image.altText: A pink pig, backlit, looks straight on at the camera, which is zoomed in on its face.

props.synopsis: The average American farmer doesn't fix fences and drive tractors. Thanks to market concentration, there is now a handful of companies that dominate the US food system, and they are impacting Australia too.

title.children: Meet the six mega-rich families running the food system

image.altText: A young man, wearing a black cap, sunglasses, and brightly coloured shirt.

props.synopsis: Family and friends remember a beloved big brother and talented rugby league player who was brutally taken from them in a ferocious stabbing frenzy.

title.children: Life in prison for man who 'hunted down' and fatally stabbed young rugby league player 42 times

props.synopsis: 21-month old Sandipan Dhar died in hospital with leukaemia after his parents raised concerns with GPs and hospital staff on several occasions about a persistent fever.

title.children: Devastated family of toddler who died at Perth hospital were told there was 'nothing to worry about'

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: New legislation in NSW will make it harder for people charged with serious domestic violence offences to get bail. The move has been welcomed by friends of Molly Ticehurst, who was allegedly murdered earlier this year.

title.children: Electronic monitoring devices will be mandatory in NSW under new bail laws inspired by Molly Ticehurst's death

image.altText: Rex Heuermann, charged in the Gilgo Beach serial killings on Long Island

props.synopsis: The New York architect accused of murdering multiple women and leaving their corpses scattered along the Long Island coast kept a "blueprint" of his crimes on his computer, prosecutors revealed.

title.children: Man charged in Gilgo beach serial killing kept 'blueprint' of crimes on computer

image.altText: Two SES team members in flood waters

props.synopsis: Residents in Sydney’s south-west fear they will be cut off from their homes for several days as floodwaters continue to rise.

title.children: Residents cut off, major flood warnings issued amid torrential rain in NSW
